alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:16AM EDT until July 11 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 715 AM EDT. * At 416 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in the past hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area through 600 am. Renewed flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Barre City, Barre Town, E F Knapp State Airport, Websterville, East Montpelier, Berlin, Plainfield, Orange, South Barre, Lower Websterville, Graniteville, Upper Graniteville and East Barre. A renewed threat of flash flooding in the immediate Barre,VT area is expected as thunderstorms have redeveloped in the area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
